dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Over 92 tons of gold liquidated by the United States in just a few months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over ninety two tons of gold liquidated by the United States in just a few months.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States which holds the highest reserves globally, added 92.23 tons, increasing its haul to 9,057.38 tons from 8,965.15 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a huge drop—from over 9,000 tons down to about 8,965. I mean, that's not a small change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a huge drop-from over nine thousand tons down to about eight thousand, nine hundred sixty five. I mean, that's not a small change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States which holds the highest reserves globally, added 92.23 tons, increasing its haul to 9,057.38 tons from 8,965.15 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Germany actually went the other way—they added more than five tons to their reserves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Germany actually went the other way-they added more than five tons to their reserves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany is second with 3,703.74 tons of Gold, having liquidated 5.4 tons from March's 3,709.14 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's not like everyone's selling. The International Monetary Fund still holds a massive amount too, like 3,000 tons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's not like everyone's selling. The International Monetary Fund still holds a massive amount too, like three thousand tons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The International Monetary Fund holds 3,100.38 tons in gold reserves, while back in March, the figure stood at 3,101.53 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But even they reduced their holdings slightly since March. It's interesting how mixed these moves are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But even they reduced their holdings slightly since March. It's interesting how mixed these moves are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The International Monetary Fund holds 3,100.38 tons in gold reserves, while back in March, the figure stood at 3,101.53 tons. The institution has liquidated a total of 1.1 tons of the precious metal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Italy and France both added a little bit, but Russia sold off over 65 tons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Italy and France both added a little bit, but Russia sold off over sixty five tons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Russia holds 2,569.72 tons in gold reserves, an addition of 65.51 tons on the 2,504.21 tons held in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty significant reduction for Russia. And China also liquidated nearly 37 tons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty significant reduction for Russia. And China also liquidated nearly thirty seven tons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has upped its reserves by 36.75 tons to 2,196.55 tons as of December 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So what's driving this? The article mentions a "dash toward gold" when the pandemic hit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So what's driving this? The article mentions a dash toward gold when the pandemic hit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the pandemic hit, most countries began a new dash towards Gold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but then it says gold no longer has that intrinsic value it used to—which might explain why some are pulling back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then it says gold no longer has that intrinsic value it used to-which might explain why some are pulling back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, Gold continues to have an intrinsic value reassuring countries of good returns in case of heightened inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Especially with all that money printing by central banks, you'd think gold would be more attractive as a hedge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially with all that money printing by central banks, you'd think gold would be more attractive as a hedge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But if countries aren't seeing good returns with potential inflation, maybe they're rethinking their strategies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But if countries aren't seeing good returns with potential inflation, maybe they're rethinking their strategies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, Gold continues to have an intrinsic value reassuring countries of good returns in case of heightened inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Switzerland and Japan both added a bit too, though—so it's really not one clear trend globally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Switzerland and Japan both added a bit too, though-so it's really not one clear trend globally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Switzerland has liquidated about 0.83 tons to record 1,145.29 tons as of December. Japan currently sits on 841.46 tons in gold reserves after liquidating 1.52 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. India sold almost 14 tons, while the Netherlands and EU bought small amounts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. India sold almost fourteen tons, while the Netherlands and E U bought small amounts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: India has gained 13.85 tons in Gold to put its current figure at 699.88 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like every country's playing a different way depending on their own economic outlook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like every country's playing a different way depending on their own economic outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder if we're in for more volatility, especially with alternative assets like Bitcoin also in the mix.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder if we're in for more volatility, especially with alternative assets like Bitcoin also in the mix.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With alternative assets such as gold and Bitcoin thriving in th...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. This might just be the calm before the exchange-rate storm, like the article suggests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. This might just be the calm before the exchange-rate storm, like the article suggests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Calm Before the Exchange-Rate Storm?

HostA: Yeah, but then it says gold no longer has that intrinsic value it used to—which might explain why some are pulling back.
HostB: Especially with all that money printing by central banks, you’d think gold would be more attractive as a hedge.
HostA: But if countries aren’t seeing good returns with potential inflation, maybe they’re rethinking their strategies.
HostB: Switzerland and Japan both added a bit too, though—so it’s really not one clear trend globally.
HostA: Exactly. India sold almost 14 tons, while the Netherlands and EU bought small amounts.
